column5: Well, It's a sad day around here as the temps creep upward and the sun is now up for 17 1/2 hours a day. All this sun and warmth is taking it's toll on our ice....................yeah, yeah, I know Boo Hoo!!!! Yesterday was my last day to drive my truck on the lake this winter as the landings are getting sketchy.  :'( Now I'm going to have to haul my gear on foot, DOH!!!!!  Here's the approach to the lake yesterday. It's starting to look a little soft in places.    Luckily there is safe ice on both sides of this soft section to gain access to the safe 3 foot plus ice beyond.    A random shot on the way to my favorite lake.    Arctic Ice Porn!!!          The Bounty!!!
Very nice report and pics.  really neat to see places that i have never been to before.  Thanks  What camera are you using?  Cheers  Craig
Beautiful fish.  Looks like a perfect day to spend on the ice.
The camera is actually my 6 year old Olympus Stylus 300. One of these days I'll have to upgrade. It has taken a beating over the years and it's still kicking though.
awesome report.  still ice up in yellow knife!    thats a nice fish congrats!
Nice Dave. Have to say I'm glad ice fishing is over with down here though.
Thanks for the ice report Dave. Now get out the flame thrower and onto open water....

Open water, that's a novel idea. The only open water around is the Yellowknife River and part of Yellowknife Bay. The rest is mostly 3 1/2 to 4 feet of solid ice. The boat won't see service for another month or so. I will probably get the 'toon out on some smaller lakes sooer though.
Great report and pics Dave  Now with the sun being 17.5 hours day leaves you with more time for fishing  Good looking laker!!! Congratulations and thanks for sharing Leechman
